articles.title: 12 Days of Christmas? 12 Stocks That Are Gifts for 2026.
articles.mainIdea: 12 Days of Christmas? 12 Stocks That Are Gifts for 2026.
articles.summary: Barrons.com: 12 Days of Christmas? 12 Stocks That Are Gifts for 2026.. Barron’s looked at the group of stocks and used Wall Street ratings and price targets by sector to find presents for any type of investor. Nvidia Amazon, and Microsoft shares are loved by the Street, with a Buy rating from more than 90% of the analysts covering them. The average Buy-rating ratio for stocks in the Russell 1000 is currently about 58%. Related tickers mentioned: ALK, AMZN, NVDA.

articles.title: Nebius Group (NBIS) Is Up 20.8% After Blackwell AI Cloud Deal Wins With Microsoft And Meta – Has The Bull Case Changed?
articles.mainIdea: Nebius Group (NBIS) Is Up 20.8% After Blackwell AI Cloud Deal Wins With Microsoft And Meta – Has The Bull Case Changed?
articles.summary: Simply Wall St.: Nebius Group (NBIS) Is Up 20.8% After Blackwell AI Cloud Deal Wins With Microsoft And Meta – Has The Bull Case Changed?. Earlier this month, Nebius Group launched Nebius AI Cloud 3.1, rolling out NVIDIA Blackwell Ultra-based infrastructure, real-time capacity tools, and stricter security and governance features for its full-stack AI cloud platform. These upgrades, combined with very large multi-year AI infrastructure agreements with Microsoft and Meta, deepen Nebius’s role as an AI infrastructure provider while heightening execution and funding demands. With Nebius now deploying Blackwell Ultra systems in... Related tickers mentioned: META, NBIS, NVDA.

articles.title: EXCLUSIVE: Jay Woods Picks His Favorite And Least Favorite Magnificent 7 Stocks For 2026 – 'A Story To Watch'
articles.mainIdea: EXCLUSIVE: Jay Woods Picks His Favorite And Least Favorite Magnificent 7 Stocks For 2026 – 'A Story To Watch'
articles.summary: Benzinga: EXCLUSIVE: Jay Woods Picks His Favorite And Least Favorite Magnificent 7 Stocks For 2026 – 'A Story To Watch'. The Magnificent Seven stocks continue to be among the most closely followed by investors, analysts and market experts. In an interview with Benzinga, Freedom Capital Markets Chief Market Strategist Jay Woods shares his favorite Magnificent 7 stocks heading into 2026 and which of the seven he's avoiding.
